text:
Had chicken rice a couple of times here and tried the curry noodles today. A good amount of meat and the bowl was filled completely. Chicken was tender and succulent. The curry noodles need a good stir before eating else the top gravy lacks flavour.
Rice was decent when I ate it. Though my neighbour mentioned that some days the rice was a little crunchy (undercooked) so it's not consistent.
Thai fried chicken cutlet had crispy skin but meat was so thin and dry. This is a big miss. Would not order it again.
Chili was a bit too salty for me.
The young staff was polite and nice whenever I patronize.
Price is slightly on the higher side, like most privately owned coffeeshops.
More hits than misses for me so still a decent food stall overall.

Boon Chiang Hainanese Chicken Rice offers authentic and flavorful chicken rice dishes, paired with fresh sides and aromatic rice. Their 4-person set meal is generously portioned and great value for money. Perfect for group dining.
Good quality whole grain rice. Pity the chilli was salty instead of tangy.
$4.50 for the most basic 1-person steamed chicken rice order and the ratio of chicken to rice was 1:10... Rice was also underwhelming. Nice staff but could be better priced

Guy with specs at front line is very professional and efficient as he conveyed
my order to the kitchen...my order of steam chicken rice with add on everything with soup takeaway is packed nicely. Will definitely patron again...
